reddit.title: Chicago builds Twitter-based food-borne illness monitoring app. In 2013, 2900 relevant tweets were reviewed by staff, 330 followed up, in the end 288 people were convinced to file a report about illness.

facebook.title: Agencies Use Social Media to Track Foodborne Illness
facebook.summary: Most cases of foodborne illness are never reported to public health authorities. But that doesn’t mean those afflicted suffer in silence. Many people turn to social media to complain and even identify food purveyors they believe are responsible. - Cities'
